twenty-Mb-occupant-behavior-environment-.title: Smart Meter behavior/environment data for medium Academic Building
twenty-Mb-occupant-behavior-environment-.summary: 20Mb of longitudinal data (minute interval) on local energy disaggregation, related behaviors, and comfort of polulation of a medium-sized Academic Building, Delhi, India.  Raw data in HDF format.

six-month-occupant-behavior-environment-.title: Six months occupant behavior/environment data for medium E.U. household
six-month-occupant-behavior-environment-.summary: Six months of longitudinal data (ten minute interval) on local thermal conditions, related behaviors, and comfort of four occupants of a medium-sized household in Chievres, Belgium, EU.  Raw data in CSV format.

one-year-occupant-behavior-environment-d.title: One year occupant behavior/environment data for medium U.S. office
one-year-occupant-behavior-environment-d.summary: One year of longitudinal data (fifteen minute interval) on local thermal conditions, related behaviors, and comfort of twenty-four occupants of a medium-sized office building in Philadelphia, PA.  Raw data in TXT format.

long-term-occupancy-data-for-a-residenti.title: Long-term occupancy data for a residential and commercial building
long-term-occupancy-data-for-a-residenti.summary: Includes information about occupancy status of three rooms in a residential home and six commercial offices.  The residential and commercial occupancy data files cover one moth with a maximum time interval of approximately fifteen minutes.  Raw data are in CSV format.

long-term-electricity-and-gas-consumptio.title: Long-term electricity and gas consumption for LBNL Building 74
long-term-electricity-and-gas-consumptio.summary: 15 minute electricity and 5 minute natural gas consumption data for Building 74 on the Lawrence Berkeley National Lab campus. Raw data in XLSX format.

long-term-energy-environment-data-for-or.title: Long-term energy/environment data for ORNL Research House # 3
long-term-energy-environment-data-for-or.summary: Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Building Technologies Research and Integration Center, Campbell Creek Research House #3 data for 2013-2014. Contains end use breakdowns of energy use and various indoor environmental conditions collected at a 15 minute time stamp.  Raw data in XLSX format.

long-term-energy-consumption-outdoor-air.title: Long-term energy consumption & outdoor air temperature for 11 commercial buildings
long-term-energy-consumption-outdoor-air.summary: Hourly energy consumption and outdoor air temperature data for 11 commercial buildings (office/retail).  Raw data in CSV format.

long-term-data-on-3-office-air-handling-.title: Long-term data on 3 office air-handling units
long-term-data-on-3-office-air-handling-.summary: Includes data on indoor/outdoor environmental conditions, supply/make up air conditions, and VAV box operations, at 1 minutes time resolution from 2014-2015. Raw data in the ZIP file are in CSV format.

enernoc-2012-commercial-energy-consumpti.title: ENERNOC 2012 Commercial Energy Consumption Data
enernoc-2012-commercial-energy-consumpti.summary: 5-minute electricity consumption for 100 anonymized commercial and industrial sites. Metadata includes randomized lat/lng, facility square footage and industry. Raw data in GreenButton and CSV formats.

openbms.title: OpenBMS
openbms.summary: BMS data (energy/environment) for various buildings on the UC-Berkeley campus. Data may be downloaded in CSV format or accessed via an API.  Further documentation at http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~stevedh/smap2/intro.html#front-ends.

gsa-energy-usage-analysis-system.title: GSA Energy Usage Analysis System
gsa-energy-usage-analysis-system.summary: The EUAS application is a web based system which serves Energy Center of Expertise, under the Office of Facilitates Management and Service Programs. EUAS is used for tracking energy details for various energy sources namely electricity, natural gas, oil, chilled water, steam and renewable energy.  Contains monthly energy consumption data as well as Heating and Cooling degree data from associated weather stations, in XLSX format.

buildings-energy-data-book.title: Buildings Energy Data Book
buildings-energy-data-book.summary: The Data Book includes statistics on residential and commercial building energy consumption. Data tables contain statistics related to construction, building technologies, energy consumption, and building characteristics.

energy-api-browser.title: Energy API browser
energy-api-browser.summary: Visual browser from the National Renewable Energy Laboratory of available energy data APIs.  The browser allows you to find new energy APIs based on keywords, so you can easily find data services that cover wind energy, building efficiency, Energy Star, or a host of other topics. API data are also available as a download.

lbnl-buildings-apis.title: LBNL Buildings APIs
lbnl-buildings-apis.summary: This site provides everything website developers need to access Lawrence Berkeley National Lab's APIs for analyzing energy use in residential and commercial buildings.

building-performance-database-api.title: Building Performance Database API
building-performance-database-api.summary: The Building Performance Database (BPD) is the nation's largest dataset of information about the energy-related characteristics of commercial and residential buildings. The BPD allows users to explore the data across real estate sectors and regions, and compare various physical and operational characteristics to gain a better understanding of market conditions and trends in energy performance.  This site has up-to-date documentation of the BPD Application Programming Interface (API).  The API enables the sharing of content and data between applications, meaning that third party web or mobile applications can be dynamically updated with BPD data.

technology-performance-exchange-api.title: Technology Performance Exchange API
technology-performance-exchange-api.summary: The Technology Performance Exchange API provides programmatic access to product and performance data.

building-components-library-api.title: Building Components Library API
building-components-library-api.summary: The Building Components Library is the U.S. Department of Energy's comprehensive online searchable library of energy modeling building blocks and descriptive metadata.

national-residential-efficiency-measures.title: National Residential Efficiency Measures Database
national-residential-efficiency-measures.summary: Here you will find tools intended to help software application developers access the data in the National Residential Efficiency Measures Database. This database of retrofit measures and associated costs can be used by software applications that evaluate residential efficiency measures.

eia-data-api.title: EIA Data API
eia-data-api.summary: Access projected residential/commercial building stock and energy consumption (down to end use and technology type) for EIA Annual Energy Outlook, 2009-2040.

openeis.title: OpenEIS
openeis.summary: Hosts open access algorithms for application to one's own building operations data.

epri-load-shape-library.title: EPRI Load Shape Library
epri-load-shape-library.summary: Electric load shapes for individual and aggregated buildings, and energy conservation measures, for a variety of climate zones, building types, and grid operating regions. Data queries made on the website can be downloaded in CSV format.

neea-building-stock-assessments.title: NEEA Building Stock Assessments
neea-building-stock-assessments.summary: Residential sub-metered electricity use data and metadata, as well as reports and metadata for commercial and industrial buildings. Raw data in plain text and Microsoft Access formats, depending on the data or metadata set.

multifamily-programmable-thermostat-data.title: Multifamily Programmable Thermostat Data
multifamily-programmable-thermostat-data.summary: This data set, compiled by the Fraunhofer Center for Sustainable Energy Systems, includes long-term 10-minute temperature and relative humidity data, and HVAC system state data for 79 apartments in a low-income housing complex in Revere, MA. The monitoring period spans two winters and one summer between 2011 and 2013. Data were collected as part of a project sponsored by the U.S. Department of Energy Building America program to evaluate the impact of programmable thermostat usability on occupant behavior.

index_source.title: One year occupant behavior/environment data for medium U.S. office
index_source.summary: One year of longitudinal data (fifteen minute interval) on local thermal conditions, related behaviors, and comfort of twenty-four occupants of a medium-sized office building in Philadelphia, PA.  Raw data in TXT format.
